importantArticles.headline: Canadian gold mining company B2Gold plans to cut 300 jobs in Namibia this year as it goes ahead with the phased downscaling of operations at its Otjikoto mine after depletion of open pit reserves.  The Otjikoto mine, which began commercial production in March 2015, produced a record 198,142 ounces of gold last year, accounting for nearly a quarter of B2Gold's total output.
importantArticles.title: B2Gold to cut 300 jobs in Namibia this year

importantArticles.title: B2Gold Announces TSX Approval for Normal Course Issuer Bid
